purpleculture_pinyin:
shāi
to filter; to sift; to sieve
фильтровать; просеивать; просеивать
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 筛)
Pictophonetic: 師 indicates the sound; ⺮ (bamboo) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
篩選 [ shāi xuǎn ]: to filter
篩糠 [ shāi kāng ]: to sift chaff; (fig.) to shake all over
篩子 [ shāi zi ]: sieve; Classifiers: 面
篩查 [ shāi chá ]: screening (medicine)
篩骨 [ shāi gǔ ]: ethmoid bone (cheek)

heisig_chinese_memo: The teacher shows the children how to use bamboo to sift through the dirt and find food in a survival situation.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The science teacher likes to sift through her stack of bamboo to find the perfect example to show the students.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Sieve " has two phonological sources, and the original meaning is also different. The original meaning of the pronunciation of "Shuyiqie" in "Guangyun" is the name of bamboo, "Guangyun·Zhiyun": "Sieve, bamboo, a Taiji. It is a hundred meters long, and it is considered a boat in the south." The original meaning of "Suojie cut" is sieve. "Jijiu Pian" "簁箄箕電", Yan Shi’s ancient note: "簁, so the thickness of the 簁 can be removed. Now it is called the sieve." was to rough take fine. "" sieve "as a" sieve "in the original meaning of the more commonly used. Tang poetry uses this original meaning, as in Li Dong's "Gong Xiluan's Return from Shu": "Sweeping the stone and the moon and filling the graves, filtering the spring with flowers full of sieve".

" Sieve " can be used as a sieve to pass through material meanings, such as "Han Shu·Jia Shan Chuan": "Sifting the soil to build the palace of Afang"; it can also be used as the meaning of penetrating through the pores, such as Mengjiao in the Tang Dynasty. 〉: "The feather fan sweeps the sweat, the cloth sails the fine wind." The meaning of passing things and passing through can also be derived from the meaning of being eliminated after selection, such as "screening people" and "screening" in modern Chinese.

" Sieving " has the meaning of shaking, sprinkling, pouring, and beating, and can also be used as a measure word.
337 Characters
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The original meaning is bamboo name or sieve.
humanum_full_description:
「篩」有兩個音韻來源，本義亦有別。《廣韻》所收「疏夷切」讀音之本義為竹名，《廣韻·脂韻》：「篩，竹，一名太極。長百丈，南方以為船。」《玉篇》所收「所街切」之本義為篩子。《急就篇》「簁箄箕帚」，顏師古注：「簁，所以籮去麤細者也，今謂之篩。」《正字通·竹部》：「篩，竹器，有孔以下物，去粗取細。」「篩」作為「篩子」的本義較常用。唐詩用此本義，如李洞〈喜鸞公自蜀歸〉：「掃石月盈箒，濾泉花滿篩」。

　　「篩」可用作用篩子過物義，如《漢書·賈山傳》：「篩土築阿房之宮」；亦可用作從孔隙中透過之義，如唐代孟郊〈送從舅端適楚地〉：「羽扇掃輕汗，布帆篩細風」，由過物、透過之義還可引申出經挑選後淘汰之義，如現代漢語的「篩人」、「篩選」等。

　　「篩」另有搖動、灑下、斟酒、敲打之義，還可用作量詞。
337 Characters

篩字的基本解释

篩
shāi
见“筛”。

篩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shāi］
［《玉篇》所街切］
“筛1”的繁体字。
(1)筛子。一种竹丝或金属丝等编制成的器具。多小孔，用以分离粗细颗粒，漏细留粗。
(2)用筛子过物。
(3)引申为穿过孔隙；漏下；分散落下。
(4)斟酒。
(5)用作量词。指盛器。
(6)见“篩酒”。
(7)击，敲。
(8)谓倾吐虚言或谎言。

篩字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　篩； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页895第07
【廣韻】疏夷切【集韻】【韻會】霜夷切【正韻】申之切，?音師。竹名。【神異經】篩竹，一名太極，長百尺，圍二丈五六尺，南方以爲船。　又竹器。有孔以下物，去麤取細。【前漢·賈山傳】篩土築阿房之宮。【師古註】篩以竹簁爲之。　又【玉篇】所街切【篇海】山皆切，?灑平聲。可以除麤去細。　【正韻】亦作簁、籭。

篩字的源字形

篩字的起名意思

Basic explanation of words
screen
shāi
See "sieve".
screen
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [shāi]
[Street cut from "Jade Pian"]
Traditional Chinese characters for "Sieve 1".
(1) Sieve. An appliance made of bamboo or metal wire. Many small holes are used to separate coarse and fine particles, leaking the fine and leaving the coarse.
(2) Pass the object with a sieve.
(3) The extension is to pass through the pores; leak down; fall apart.
(4) Pour wine.
(5) Used as a quantifier. Refers to the container.
(6) See "Sifting Wine".
(7) Hit, knock.
(8) It is said to pour out falsehoods or lies.
screen

[Not set on] [Bamboo characters department] 　 sieve; Kangxi strokes: 16; page number: page 895 page 07
[Guangyun] Shuyiqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Shuangyiqie [Zhengyun] Shenzhiqie,? Musician. Bamboo name. [Supernatural Sutra] Sieve bamboo, a Tai Chi, one hundred feet long, two feet five or six feet long, the southern part is considered a boat.　Bamboo. If there are holes or below, remove the coarser and finer. [Previous Han·Jia Shan Biography] Sieving the soil to build the palace of Afang. [Teacher's Note] The sieve is made of bamboo 簁.　[Jade articles] All the streets cut [Pianhai] The mountains are all cut, and the sound is flat. You can remove coarse to fine.　【Zhengyun】It is also used as 簁 and 籭.
